{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3135571,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-28T21:21:34.801Z","cooked":"

Our robot turns 90 degrees in autonomous before starting the path we specify. It’s really weird, i’ve never encountered this before. In pathweaver, our path starts pointing towards the grid and is just supposed to reverse onto the charging station.

Here is our code: Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 · GitLab

If anyone can help that would be great!!

Dug through your code. I believe it’s because you are resetting your gyro when you call resetOdometry. Rather than setting your gyro to 0, try setting your gyro to the initial rotation of the pose. In our Pathweaver code from last year, we called Pigeon.setYaw(pose.getRotation().getDegrees) to update the gyro’s rotation (different gyro than yours…but you get the idea). This should hopefully fix any rotation issues you are having. If that doesn’t help, could you post a picture of your robots path?

I’m not sure if there is a way to reset my specific model of gyroscope to a specific angle. I’m not seeing anything in the documentation for setting the angle.

Gandagorn:

station

I don’t believe you can reset your gyro to a specific angle, so consider adding a variable gyroOffset (I’m not sure which way your robot is turning, so try setting it to -90 degrees or 90 degrees. You can set this value at the end of your autonomous) to your driveSubsystem. Then, make your getHeading method something like:

public double getHeading() {
  return (m_IMU.getAngle() + gyroOffset) % 360;
}

So when I call resetodometry, instead of calling getangle from the imu class I should call getheading()?
